item.title: 8 Deadly Sins of Distributed Systems
item.description: There are 8 deadly sins mostly ignored when designing and implementing distributed applications. I want to start my blog with analysis of these points: The network is reliable; Latency is zero; Bandwidth is infinite; The network is secure; Topology doesn’t change; There is one administrator; Transport cost is zero; The network is homogeneous. 1. Network is reliable Let’s be honest, the network is never reliable. And in most of the cases is the “scapegoat”.
